name: Create a dropshipping store
description: Dropshipping is an e-commerce technique. The core idea is to create an online shop which basically relays any purchases made through it to other online retailers which then send the product directly to the customer. The dropshipping store owner collects a commission. Its main advantage is that it's not necessary to have a permanent storage of the goods to be sold. The main disadvantage is that you as the store owner have to take liability for deliveries and products from the third-party shops you relay the orders to. This can, theoretically, result in massive financial drawbacks.
major_pros: Scalable
low initial capital requirement
feasible to do from home
major_cons: highly leveraged
long-term liability risks (years)
high-impact liability risks

name: Buy an accumulating, globally diversified ETF
description: ETFs, Exchange Traded Funds are an asset class that was invented in the 1970s. The main idea is to setup a fund that replicates a given index like the S&P 500 or the DAX and participate in the overall development of this index instead of betting on single stocks. Furthermore, due to mimicking an index, an ETF is usually passive, which means that there is no fund manager who actively manages the funds composition. This significantly reduces the cost associated with purchasing and holding the fund over time. Usually, ETF investors also utilize a passive investment strategy, e.g. they buy and hold their assets for longer periods of time (think years up to multiple decades).
major_pros: Very simple to execute and relatively low risk
Lower taxes on capital gains than work income (in Germany)
No company setup or lifestyle changes required
major_cons: Unspecific, certain users may have opportunity cost
Long-Term only
Overall return potential is relatively low

name: Trade Commodities
description: Commodities like crude oil, gold, or other precious metals can also be traded on stock exchanges.
major_pros: Higher earnings potential compared to passive investing
No company setup or massive lifestyle changes required
major_cons: Significantly more risky than passive investing
Active participation required, therefore time-consuming

name: Trade FOREX
description: FOREX, 'Foreign Exchange' trading refers to trading of certain fiat currency pairs. Common pairs include EURO/USD, GBP/USD, USD/JPY. Generally speaking, this is a more advanced type of trying to earn money on the financial markets. However, due to its well-defined assets (currencies backed by states), it offers certain characteristics that may allow exploitation, especially for algorithmic trading.
major_pros: Higher earnings potential compared to passive investing
No company setup or massive lifestyle changes required
major_cons: Significantly more risky than passive investing
Active participation required, therefore time-consuming

name: Buy dividend stocks (e.g. so-called 'dividend aristocrats'
description: Generally speaking, there are two major reasons why people or organizations buy stocks. The first is growth (e.g. they hope the market value of the stock will rise), the second is dividends. A dividend is a cash payment made by the company to its shareholders, proportionally to their relative share in the company.
major_pros: Very simple to execute and relatively low risk
Lower taxes on capital gains than work income (in Germany)
No company setup or lifestyle changes required
major_cons: Unspecific, certain users may have opportunity cost
Long-Term only
Overall return potential is relatively low

name: Buy a dividend-yielding globally diversified ETF
description: This strategy points to buying and holding an ETF
major_pros: Very simple to execute and relatively low risk
Lower taxes on capital gains than work income (in Germany)
No company setup or lifestyle changes required
major_cons: Unspecific, certain users may have opportunity cost
Long-Term only
Overall return potential is relatively low

name: Utilize a robo-advisor to setup an ETF-based portfolio
description: A robo-advisor is essentially an automated form of investing in ETFs and bonds. The core idea is to have active management, not by humans, but by some sort of machine learning model. While the overall idea seems compelling, the associated costs may eat up the advantage over a non-managed index fund.
major_pros: Very simple to execute and relatively low risk
Lower taxes on capital gains than work income (in Germany)
No company setup or lifestyle changes required
major_cons: Unspecific, certain users may have opportunity cost
Long-Term only
Overall earnings potential is relatively low, robo-advisors are not free

name: create an amazon marketplace, ebay, or shopify shop
major_pros: Scalable, especially when selling digital products
major_cons: Company setup and tax paperwork required

name: Become a Medium.com writer or blogger
description: Medium.com (or similar platforms) allow users to become independent authors / writers. You can write on any topic, but most articles are related to technology, self-improvement, and personal finance. Medium sells a subscription to users and authors get paid for any minute paying users spend reading their articles. If an article 'goes viral' this can result in significant earnings. However, the average author can not live solely off the platform.
major_pros: Individual and specific, for talented
major_cons: Earnings potential, especially at the beginning very limited
Medium.com as a platform is probably already saturated

name: Trade cryptocurrencies
description: Crypto is the new kid on the block in terms of asset classes and made a steep career over the last few years, from an absolute niche to something institutional investors trade. It is, of course, also possible to create crypto as a retail investor and many made significant gains from doing so. However, significant caveats apply: cryptocurrencies have no deep value at all, they aren't backed by anything. Therefore, there is also no interest and no dividends. Additionally, the market is very volatile and influenced by mere opinions of people. Also, unbiased information on the topic is relatively seldom to find.
major_pros: Higher earnings potential compared to passive investing
No company setup or massive lifestyle changes required
major_cons: Significantly more risky than passive investing
Active participation required, therefore time-consuming

name: Setup mirror trading for a well-known trader on a platform like eTORO or Public.com
description: So-called social trading platforms like eTORO allow for mirroring (e.g. copying and replicating) the trades of other people. You can do this by hand by watching a social media feed-like stream of events or by completely automating the process. The main advantage is that you can profit from other people's knowledge, the main drawback is you are tying your luck to someone else's knowledge. However, through careful selection of the person to mirror, one may achieve above-market returns in specific areas, where this person may be an expert. The main point is that your invested decision is not removed, but shifted.
major_pros: Higher earnings potential compared to passive investing
No company setup or massive lifestyle changes required
Possibility to profit from other people's knowledge
major_cons: Significantly more risky than passive investing
Careful selection of the person to mirror is required
You are basically tying your luck to someone else's investing style

name: Create and monetize online content on various platforms,
description: Various (social media) platforms allow for content creation to be monetized. Therefore, at least theoretically, anyone can do so. In practice this requires selecting an appropriate niche, creating blog articles, videos or other posts to cater to it, and after reaching a certain level of range (e.g. followers) monetizing the content. However, this is more easily said than done. Only a few people trying to do so actually can monetize their content and even then only a few can make a living off of it. But if you manage to do so, the scalability is quite high and it may also act as an outlet for self expression.
major_pros: Slow start possible, low capital requirements
Relatively scalable
Individual and specific, for talented users a way to also express themselves
major_cons: Earning potential, at least in the beginning is very low
A lot is learnable, but you need a certain degree of talent
Paperwork for self-employment, taxation etc. required

name: Get into remote, freelancing or self-employed work, then move to a country / location with significantly lower cost of living ('also known under the term of geo-arbitrage')
description: The core idea of this strategy is that in today's digital economy, it is possible to do full-remote work, therefore rendering the exact location where people work from irrelevant. Accordingly, it is possible to move to a country or area with lower cost of living (and possibly taxes), to save money in the long run. Technically, this is both possible for salaried an self-employed work. However, the increased flexibility of self-employed or entrepreneurial work types may come in handy. The main drawback is the massive lifestyle change required.
major_pros: Very high impact, especially over longer timeframe
Very flexible if executed correctly
major_cons: Very massive lifestyle changes required
Your job needs to be feasible remotely
Generally speaking, probably a not very stable lifestyle model, you really need to want to do this.

name: AirBnB Hosting
description: It is possible to rent out a flat and host it on AirBnb even if you do not own any property. However, certain laws and regulations apply, so it is required to check beforehand whether it is actually possible to do so. Additionally, you are essentially conducting a leveraged business model and have to carry certain liabilities, which may cause problems should you have AirBnB renters who damaage or destroy property.
major_pros: Very profitable if executed correctly
Scalable, but relatively low initial capital requirement
major_cons: Various liability and legal risks
company setup most likely required, general paperwork
You are effectively 'wasting' an apartment people could live in permanently to resell it for personal gain.

name: Consulting, Coaching and other types of freelancing work
description: Depending on your job and previous experience you may have some specific skills other people may be willing to buy as a service from you. This can include a wide range of topics, including but not limited to marketing, IT / Software, content authoring, proofreading, nutrition, sports.
major_pros: Flexible
Can monetize existing skills
major_cons: not infinitely scalable
lifestyle changes required
specific knowledge and marketing / sales talent required

name: Create an online course to sell on platforms like Udemy.com
description: Due to platforms like udemy, anyone can create a digital course on basically every possible topic. These courses can then be monetized on such platforms.
major_pros: Theoretically infinitely scalable
Level of commitment is relatively low
No significant lifestyle changes required
can monetize existing skills
major_cons: You actually need specific skills on the topic to make a reasonable course
The topic needs to be in demand, or can fall out of it over time

name: Create a print-on-demand-shop with your designes
major_pros: Theoretically infinitely scalable
Level of commitment is relatively low
No significant lifestyle changes required
can monetize existing skills
major_cons: You actually need specific skills on the topic to make a reasonable course
The topic needs to be in demand, or can fall out of it over time
